title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 581-3.3 - Permit holder response to notice of intent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 581-3.3 - Permit holder response to notice of intent

State Regulations

Within 30 days of the date of the notice of intent, the
permit holder may serve a written response upon the executive director signed
by the permit holder or his attorney giving reasons why the permit should not
be modified, suspended or revoked, including the material facts, documentary
evidence, and the provisions of law upon which such statement is based, and if
desired, requesting a hearing. If the permit holder fails to respond to the
notice of intent within such 30-day period, the agency may accept as correct
the allegations of fact and law set forth in the notice of
intent. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
581-3.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
